message:
About an hour ago, an empty lot was attacked in the area of ​​the "Amuaj" Hall in Rafah, near the tents of displaced persons.
This is one of the reasons for the mass movement towards the beach in Rafah.

Rafah, southern Gaza Strip:
Palestinian channels report a large movement of displaced persons from the area of ​​the "Amuaj" Hall in West Rafah towards the seashore following an unverified report of an Israeli demand to evacuate the area.

##
The pressure there is high.

Hamas Information Bureau:

"Approximately 10% of the bombs and shells fired by the occupation into the Gaza Strip did not explode, according to UN estimates, which we back up.
According to the estimates, this is 7.5 million tons of bombs out of 75 million tons of bombs that were fired into the Gaza Strip.
They pose a great danger to the residents of the Gaza Strip, even if the war ends."

Abdel Latif Al Qanouna, Hamas spokesman:
"Without achieving the just demands of our people regarding a permanent ceasefire, the withdrawal of the forces and the return of the displaced, no agreement with the occupation will succeed."

Updated cigarette price list in Gaza:
Single cigarette - 45 NIS
A box of cigarettes (20 cigarettes) - NIS 900
Packet of cigarettes (10 boxes) - NIS 9,000
Egyptian Foreign Minister: Cairo is optimistic about a new Hudna agreement between Hamas and Israel.

American Secretary of State Blinken, during his visit to Saudi Arabia:

Hamas has an extraordinarily generous proposal for a ceasefire, it needs to decide, and decide quickly.

The US did not receive from Israel a plan for an attack on Rafah that includes the protection of civilians.

The conflict in Gaza must be ended, the blueprint for the establishment of a Palestinian state and progress towards normalization must be laid.

###
All these statements are very disturbing and indicate that the Americans do not understand a thing and a half about the Middle East and conducting negotiations.

Beirut: Hezbollah militants detained two trucks of the Spanish battalion in UNIFIL while they were passing through the Shahdaa square at the entrance to the Dahiya district, a Hezbollah stronghold in the Lebanese capital.

Lebanese army soldiers were sent to rescue the trucks.

The Palestinian Ministry of Health in Gaza:

34 dead in the Strip in the last day.
In the days preceding it, the number of deaths per day was as follows:
66
32
51

34,488 dead and 76,643 wounded in the Gaza Strip since the beginning of the war.

Lebanon: concern over the strengthening of the "Al-Jama'a al-Islamiya" organization, with Iran's support

The sights that came yesterday from Akkar in northern Lebanon, where a funeral was held for two senior members of the Al-Jama'a al-Islamiyya organization in Lebanon, whom Israel killed in a targeted strike on their vehicle, are causing concern among the circles opposed to the Iranian axis in Lebanon.

The amount of weapons seen at the funeral arouses criticism and concern that the Sunni organization, which is apparently supported by Iran, is also planning to follow the path of Hezbollah and establish military strongholds in Lebanon, such as Hezbollah's Dahiya district in Beirut.
The military arm of Hamas in Lebanon accepts responsibility for launching 30 rockets from southern Lebanon towards the headquarters of the 769th Brigade in Camp Gibor, a short while ago.

The Palestinians report a total of 20 deaths tonight, in attacks on 3 houses in Rafah in the southern Gaza Strip:

1. The house of the Abu Ta family in the A-Salam neighborhood in the southeast of Rafah.
2. The house of the Khatib family in the Janineh neighborhood in eastern Rafah.
3. The house of the Khawaja family in the Shaboura neighborhood in the center of Rafah.

In addition, it was reported that four Palestinians were killed tonight in an attack on the house of the A-Tarturi family in the Harbor neighborhood in the west of Gaza City.

Palestinian terrorist Basem Khandakji, who is serving three life sentences in Israel for his involvement in the Carmel market suicide attack in November 2004, in which three Israelis were killed and more than 50 were injured, won the International Prize for Arabic Fiction, funded by the UAE, for his book "a mask the color of the sky," which he wrote in prison.

The terrorist's brother received the award on his behalf. The host of the ceremony wished that Khandakji's release from the Israeli prison would come soon.

Senior Hamas official Izzat al-Risheq, earlier this morning:

"It should be emphasized that Hamas has not published any statement in its name or on its behalf, or on behalf of its sources regarding the Israeli proposal we received from the mediators. We are still studying the proposal.

Everything that the media in Israel publishes on the matter is meant to cause confusion.
The military wing of Hamas recently accepted responsibility for firing mortar shells at the Netzarim base in the Gaza Strip.

Ismail Haniyeh, chairman of the political bureau of Hamas, started "receiving an audience" in Istanbul, Turkey.
Among the visitors: Jordanian members of parliament and Nelson Mandela's grandson.

And meanwhile in Aqar in northern Lebanon... Al-Jama'a al-Islamiyya supporters are demonstrating what "real" shooting in the air is as part of the funeral of the two senior leaders, Masab and Bilal Khalaf, who were killed by the IDF in an attack on their vehicle...

For Jama'a, anything less than RPG shooting in the air is dishonoring the dead...

The international organization World Central Kitchen has announced a return to activity in the Gaza Strip for the first time since 7 of its people were killed in an Israeli attack following a mistaken identity about a month ago.

##
At the same time, the White House reports that within two to three weeks the floating sea dock in the Gaza Strip will begin operating.

Several followers contacted me with the question of whether Gazans are returning from the south of the Gaza Strip to the north.

Well the answer is: No!

About two weeks ago there were reports 👆 of a number of Palestinians who managed to cross into Gaza City, and the next day, immediately after the rumors spread, a huge line of vehicles and displaced people who decided they were going back to the north stretched out. The displaced were stopped by the IDF (there were also reports of deaths among them from IDF fire).

The Saudi Asharq channel from its sources:

"Hamas is satisfied with the progress in the new document in the area of ​​the return of the displaced to their homes and the distance to which the Israeli forces will withdraw, but it demands that the document include in writing the subject of the cessation of the war and the Israeli withdrawal at the end of the negotiations. The delegation that will arrive in Cairo will discuss the classification of the prisoners to be released in the first phase and their number."
Reuters from a Hamas official: A Hamas delegation is expected to arrive in Cairo tomorrow to discuss a ceasefire deal.

In the shadow of the rising prices of cigarettes in the Gaza Strip (over 40 NIS for a single cigarette), one of the residents of the Gaza Strip decided to "recycle" empty cartridges of bullets fired by IDF soldiers and turn them into smoking utensils.... Now all that remains is to get tobacco... or another herb...
The rise in anti-Semitism in the UK: Police cover an etched boulder at Hyde park's Holocaust Memorial Garden to protect it from anti-Semitic mobs.

Yesterday, the IDF spokesman in Arabic published the attached photos of the logistics area that was being built next to the floating peir in Gaza, the establishment of which was decided by President Biden.

Gazan residents on Facebook are certain: this is further proof that the Israelis are re-establishing the Netzer settlement.

Elon Musk retweeted an old video from 2017 this morning, in which the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the United Arab Emirates points to the West's lack of understanding of Islamic culture, claiming it will lead to a rise in Islamic radicalism.

The clip Musk retweeted was posted by "Visegard 24", a popular channel which uploads pro-Israeli content regularly.
Here, for comparison, is an anti-Israel demonstration at University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign - in Illinois, USA.

Vancouver, Canada: A demonstration of Iranians against the Iranian regime, following the recent death sentences handed down by Iranian judges to political prisoners, among them Iranian rapper Toomaj Salehi, who dared to criticize the Ayatollahs' regime in his songs.

Note the differences between the quiet and polite demonstrations by the Iranian expatriates and the violent and rowdy demonstrations of the anti-Israeli students in the US and Canada.

Hezbollah publishes footage of an attack it claims to have carried out yesterday at around 5 PM (local time) on Golani's 51st Battalion in Kibbutz Menara.

In the documentation you can see two guided missiles being launched one after the other at two targets (one of which is well camouflaged), with Hezbollah drones documenting the attacks from several angles.
Washington University in St. Louis, Missouri - Police officers arrest students participating in the anti-Israeli protests.
Palestinian channels wail: "Zionists are vandalizing a building at Columbia University in New York because a Palestinian flag was flown there."

Hezbollah accepts responsibility for launching dozens of Katyusha rockets towards Miron in response to IDF attacks in southern Lebanese villages, earlier today, including the attacks in Kozah, Merkaba and Serbin (where there was a high number of wounded - AA).
What fills the Arab channels in the last few hours are the videos from Tel Aviv showing the confrontations between the protesters and the police. This is the hottest item in Middle East tonight.
Qatari Al Jazeera network: 30 rockets were fired from Lebanon in the last few minutes towards the Upper Galilee.
Deir al-Balah in the center of the Gaza Strip: The Palestinians are trying to deal with a bomb that did not explode and went through the wall of the building into the nearby alley.
Unofficial Lebanese sources: 2 dead and 12 wounded in an IDF attack this evening in the village of Sarbin in southern Lebanon.
A video that has gone viral on social networks: a National Guard officer in the state of Georgia in the USA is not moved by the attempt to interfere with the arrest...
The Gazans are complaining: the Americans are dropping Skittles that have expired from the sky...
Lebanese channels report casualties in the IDF attack in the last hour in the village of Sarbin in southern Lebanon.

This is the text in Hebrew (the errors in the original - AA) published this evening by the military wing of Hamas together with the video of the abductees:

الضغط العسكري أدى إلى مقتل عشرات الأسرى الذين بأيدينا وحرم البقية من الاحتفال بعيد الفصح مع أعزائهم
הלחץ הצבאי הוביל להרג עשרות השביויים שביידנו ומנע משאר השבויים לחגוג הפסח עם יקריהם
The military pressure led to the killing of dozens of prisoners by our hands and deprived the rest of them from celebrating Passover with their loved ones

# الوقت_ينفد
# הזמן_אוזל
# حكومتكم_تكذب 
# ממשלתים_שקרנית
# time_is_running_out
# government_of_liars

##
Hamas is trying to stop the military pressure on it
The Gazans in Rafah thank the students at Columbia University in the USA, making sure to bring kids into the frame to complete the message.

The Lebanese Al Mayadeen from a source in the "Palestinian Resistance":

"The Israeli proposal submitted does not express a fundamental change in the Israeli position.

It does not give clear answers regarding the total ceasefire and the withdrawal of forces.

Hamas is still examining the proposal, but there are no great expectations regarding acceptance of the proposal unless substantial changes are applied to it."

##
It is important for Hamas to show that it is conducting the negotiations from a position of strength.

After the "success" of the previous video of Hersh Goldberg-Polin, the military wing of Hamas published a short time ago another video in which Keith Siegel and Omri Miren are filmed calling for the continuation of the demonstrations for their release in order to influence the negotiations.

##
Hamas feels that it is benefiting from the videos in the negotiations and therefore publishes the additional video today.
